description: Document Scope in dot notation (Epic.Sub-Epic.Story.Scenario) and individual Walk covers (what each traces). Example: Scope: Run REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action.Execute Instructions -> Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-3 (parse, navigate), Walk 2 - Covers: Step 4 (execute)

do.description: Document Scope at scenario level and Covers for each walk. Example: Scope: Run REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action.Execute Instructions (parent context) with Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-3, Walk 2 - Covers: Step 4 (granular coverage per walk)

guidance.description: Use dot notation for Scope showing full hierarchy. Example: Scope: Run Interactive REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action Operation.Execute Instructions NOT bullet list with Epic:, Sub-Epic:, Story:
example: Scope: Run Interactive REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action Operation Through CLI.Execute Instructions Operation
(Use compact dot notation, not bullet list)

guidance.description: Each walk specifies granular coverage. Example: Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-3 (parse, navigate); Walk 2 - Covers: Step 4 (execute); or Walk 1 - Covers: Sub-epics: Execute, Manage; or Walk 1 - Covers: Stories: Story1, Story2
example: Walk 1 - Covers: Sub-epics: Execute Operations, Manage Scope

guidance.description: Scope can be at any story graph level. Example: Epic scope with sub-epic walks: Scope: Run REPL, Walk 1 - Covers: Sub-epics: Execute, Manage; Story scope with step walks: Scope: Run REPL.Execute.Action.Instructions, Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-3
example: Walk 1 - Covers: Sub-epics: Execute Operations, Manage Scope
Walk 1 - Covers: Stories: Execute Action, Execute Command
Scope: Run Interactive REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action.Execute Instructions
(Scope shows parent context, walks show granular coverage)

guidance.description: Store scope and walks in story graph. Example: 'scope': 'Run REPL.Execute.Action.Instructions', 'walks': [{'walk_number': 1, 'covers': 'Steps 1-3', 'object_flow': '...'}, {'walk_number': 2, 'covers': 'Step 4', 'object_flow': '...'}]
example: (Scope shows parent context, walks array shows granular traces)

dont.description: Don't use vague coverage or incomplete dot notation. Example: Scope: Execute Action (wrong - incomplete) vs Scope: Run REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action.Execute Instructions (right); Walk - Covers: Main steps (wrong - vague) vs Walk - Covers: Steps 1-3 (parse, navigate) (right)

guidance.description: Don't use incomplete dot notation for Scope. Example: Scope: Execute Action Operation (wrong - missing epic/sub-epic) vs Scope: Run REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action.Execute Instructions (right - full path)
example: Scope: Run Interactive REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action Operation Through CLI.Execute Instructions
(Include full path from epic to scenario)

guidance.description: Don't use vague walk coverage. Example: Walk - Covers: Main steps (wrong) vs Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-3 (parse, navigate) (right); Walk - Covers: Happy path (wrong) vs Walk 2 - Covers: Step 4 (execute) (right)
example: Walk 2 - Covers: Most of the flow
(Be specific and explicit about what each walk covers)

guidance.description: Don't put all steps in one walk. Example: Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-10 (entire scenario) (wrong) vs Walk 1 - Covers: Steps 1-3 (setup), Walk 2 - Covers: Steps 4-6 (execute), Walk 3 - Covers: Steps 7-10 (display) (right)
example: (Break complex flows into multiple walks to show collaborations)

guidance.description: Don't mix scope levels in one realization. Example: Scope: Run REPL (epic) with Walk - Covers: Steps 1-3 (wrong - mismatch) vs Scope: Run REPL with Walk - Covers: Sub-epics: Execute, Manage (right - match level)
example: Walk 1 - Covers: Sub-epics: Execute Operations, Manage Scope
Scope: Run Interactive REPL.Execute Operations.Execute Action.Execute Instructions
